Articles.Content: Here's mine
I don't draw. Page 1 is a Flite Test power pod? Just started getting into the RC plane hobby and literally built my first DTFB plane on Saturday. Haven't flown it yet...

Yep, I have several aircraft including a Flyer, a Storch, and an Explorer.

Btw, good luck. Remember, trees actively move to intercept aircraft.

On May 31, 2016 at 11:16 AM, EnderKid2 said:

Btw, good luck. Remember, trees actively move to intercept aircraft.

This cannot be any more true.

 

I don't have a sketchbook. I do have a folder containing images on my desktop, though. Including a picture of me in airsoft gear, the Mun, logos for my old CS team, my cat, Black Hat from xkcd, and Unturned map pictures. And other stuff!
I have stacks of sketch books filled with graffiti sketches, over 20 years worth of it. The note book I use for KSP has just notes, numbers, modlists, action goup lists, etc
Blank paper.  I'm terrible at drawing.

6 hours ago, CliftonM said:

I'm terrible at drawing

Inkscape allows to draw lines/arcs/other primitives and then to move points into exact direction by inserting coordinates in a dialog.
Also it has guide lines which also can be positioned with exact numbers - and auto-attach mode.
And objects grouping allows to make ship parts and copy/paste them.

Edited June 3, 2016 by kerbiloid

7 hours ago, kerbiloid said:

Inkscape allows to draw lines/arcs/other primitives and then to move points into exact direction by inserting coordinates in a dialog.
Also it has guide lines which also can be positioned with exact numbers - and auto-attach mode.
And objects grouping allows to make ship parts and copy/paste them.

Well, if you're going to include that, then I have quite a bit of stuff in GIMP.

I used to have volumes of sketchpads like this.  Sadly, that was a long time ago, and they're long gone.  

But I can't tell you how great it is to see the tradition is going strong!!!  Well done!!!!

I have so many sheets of graph paper with huge rockets sitting around I don't even call it a sketchbook! I call it my "giant pile of stuff that is super unorganized and is almost a fire hazard" lol.

I've gone through all the graph paper in my house, and two teachers rooms. Maybe I need to clean it soon...
